decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while also utilizing Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out big creatures like Agent of Treachery. The deck also includes key planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's plans. With a mix of removal spells and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish board control to ultimately win the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. By combining Teferi, Narset, and Lukka, the deck can manipulate the board and generate card advantage. Yorion serves as a companion, providing additional value through its enter-the-battlefield effect. The deck also includes removal spells like Deafening Clarion and Shatter the Sky to deal with threats, while cards like Agent of Treachery help to steal important permanents from the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and efficient card choices.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly through cycling cards for value and efficient aggression. By utilizing cycling abilities on cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of early aggression and late-game finishers like Zenith Flare. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to bring back key cycling creatures from the graveyard. By maximizing the cycling mechanic and synergies within the deck, this aggro-cycling archetype aims to quickly close out games with efficient damage output.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap cycling cards to quickly build a threatening board presence and pressure the opponent early in the game. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck can recur key cycling cards from the graveyard and maintain card advantage. By cycling through cards such as Boon of the Wish-Giver and Memory Leak, followed by powerful payoff cards like Zenith Flare, the deck aims to close out the game swiftly by dealing large amounts of damage directly to the opponent.

This Bant Control deck focuses on using a variety of powerful enchantments and planeswalkers to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's plans, coupled with efficient removal options like Elspeth Conquers Death and Shatter the Sky, this deck aims to play a longer game and out-resource the opponent. Key threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Dream Trawler provide win conditions and card advantage to help secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and removal while generating value through card draw and recursion. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion to provide additional card advantage and flexibility in the late game. The deck utilizes a variety of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes a strong suite of instant-speed removal spells to handle threats efficiently. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of tempo plays and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board using removal spells and creature abilities while ramping up mana with Arboreal Grazer to cast powerful threats like Questing Beast and Shifting Ceratops. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with quick, aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks like Embercleave. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds an additional layer of synergy and versatility to the deck. With a strong mix of removal, ramp, and powerful creatures, the Jund Control archetype aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence.

The main concept of this Temur Control deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removal, and card advantage using cards like Frilled Mystic, Mystical Dispute, Scorching Dragonfire, and Negate. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also generating value with Wilderness Reclamation and Shark Typhoon. The win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Nightpack Ambusher and Brazen Borrower, while also finishing off the game with Expansion / Explosion.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Neutralize. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death to deal with threats on the board. The ramp provided by Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath helps the deck reach its late-game win conditions, which include Shark Typhoon for creating threats and Agent of Treachery for taking control of key permanents.

The deck focuses on using cycling abilities to build a strong aggressive board presence and cycling through the deck for more options and resources. It aims to quickly assemble a critical mass of creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent before finishing them off with a big Zenith Flare. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing players to cast small creatures from their graveyard. The composition of the deck ensures quick and efficient cycling while maintaining a solid aggro strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards in order to build a board presence with cheap creatures and spells. The goal is to be aggressive and constantly apply pressure to the opponent, using cards like Zenith Flare to finish them off. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion that can provide additional value by bringing back key cycling creatures. Overall, the deck aims to be fast and efficient in dealing damage while maintaining card advantage through cycling.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Fires of Invention. The goal is to slow down the opponent's strategy, while generating card advantage and value through effects like Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck also aims to maintain card advantage and board presence through cards like Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion to provide additional value and recursion throughout the game. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its control strategy.

This deck aims to maintain control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, eventually overwhelming the opponent with a large number of flying tokens or powerful creatures like Dream Trawler. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a way to generate additional value by flickering permanents and triggering enter-the-battlefield effects. The deck plays a defensive, reactive game plan, using its powerful planeswalkers and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect itself until it can establish a dominant board presence.

This deck focuses on being aggressive and using Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat powerful creatures into play. It includes a mix of low-cost creatures like Lazotep Reaver and Grim Initiate to trigger Winota's ability, as well as powerful creatures like Anax, Hardened in the Forge and Tajic, Legion's Edge to capitalize on the extra attacks. Fight as One and Embercleave provide additional combat tricks and buffs to help push damage through and overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is built to support the deck's three-color requirements.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Winota, Joiner of Forces to quickly and aggressively summon powerful creatures onto the battlefield. By including a mix of low-cost creatures like Charming Prince and Raise the Alarm, alongside higher-cost creatures such as Agent of Treachery and Legion Warboss, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of attacks and triggered abilities. The inclusion of cards like Incubation / Incongruity and Fblthp, the Lost add consistency and flexibility to the deck's strategy, making it a formidable force in 1 vs 1 gameplay.
